body:
ðŸ‘‹ Thanks for opening your first issue here! If you're reporting a ðŸž bug, please make sure you include steps to reproduce it. We get a lot of issues on this repo, so please be patient and we will get back to you as soon as we can.

To help make it easier for us to investigate your issue, please follow the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-issues).
@jasonrudolph  Please use GH reactions instead of adding a "+1" comment.
@MarshallOfSound what is a "GH Reaction"? Why is it not mentioned in https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-issues?
GH reaction == GitHub reaction, you used one just now to thumbs down my comment asking you to use them ðŸ¤”
@MarshallOfSound which emoji should I use for confirming the version? since we're getting specific.
Your initial comment did not contain a version number and therefore could have simply been replaced with a thumbs up on the original issue

> @jasonrudolph Please use GH reactions instead of adding a "+1" comment.

@MarshallOfSound: As someone that got a notification from you for a thread I'm not even participating in, is it helpful for me to say, "Please make sure you're @mentioning the right person."??? ðŸ˜œ
Haha, sorry Jason.  Been doing this from my phone and didn't check the at mention, my bad ðŸ˜¸
@mhashmi is there other way to fix this bug?

Guys, a solution has been posted for this issue in bug report #4776, alongside sample code. I've tested it on OS X, and the user who posted it tested it on Linux, so we at least have a workaround now!
